This village is in the middle of an important commercial, scientific, artistic, sports and touristic region, between

, near Bierset and Tihange, and very easy to access, at only 500 m. from the N90 Liège-Huy motorway.  Hermalle includes nearly its castle and its monumental farm, a complex of elegant houses of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries.

Located along the Meuse (important European river), Hermalle is also at the foot of the Ardennes and therefore offers interesting differences in height for hikers and cyclists.

In time past important village of the region, fief of the episcopal court of Liège with its own court and vassals, Hermalle has escaped the industrialization of the nineteenth century and maintains a countryside charm.

Hermalle, which is located on the right bank of the Meuse, is included since 1977 in the Engis entity whose administrative center is located on the left bank of the river.

The nearest airport is Liège-Bierset. 

Engis station is served only by slow trains. It is easier to go by train to Liège and Huy then taking a bus TEC line 9 (Opéra - Seraing - Engihoul - Flône - Tihange - Huy). Get off at "Place de Hermalle".

By car : 
The nearest motorway is E42. Choose Exit 6 (Villers-le-Bouillet/Amay) if you go to Liège, exit 4 (Flémalle) if you comes from Liège, to join the national road 90 and leave this road at the exit "Pont de Hermalle".

On foot or by bike, take the RAVeL 1, along the Meuse, to easily reach the village which lies also on the Great Hiking Trail 576.

The "Ferme castrale", old farm adjacent to the castle of Hermalle still ringed by moat. The farm became a center of culture and tourism with its two museums and its Gourmet library.

; there is a second-hand books and flea market, a tavern to eat as before, etc. From the courtyard, you can see XVIIth century castle (private property) - mosan style. The "Ferme castrale" is open on Saturday from 14 pm, Sunday from 11 am and it closes at 19 pm (November to February: 18 pm). It can be visited on weekdays, by appointment, for groups of minimum 15 persons.

On appointement, you can visit (guided tour), in the Ferme castrale, the

(history of food and cooking) and the museum "Postes restantes" (history of writing and the Post Office).

On appointement too, and only for searchers, the Goumet library, one of the largest gastronomic library in Europe with more than 20,000 books, can be open for searching information on food and drink.

Enjoy walks in Hermalle, Clermont-sous-Huy and Engis: the country is really superb.
